title: Ana Sagar Lake
review: Ana Sagar Lake is an artificial lake situated in the city of Ajmer in Rajasthan state in India. It was built by Arnoraja (alias Ana), the grandfather of Prithviraj Chauhan, in 1135 -1150 AD and is named after him. The catchments were built with the help of local populace. The lake is spread over 13 Kilometers. The Baradari or pavilions were built by Shahjahan in 1637 and Daulat Bagh Gardens by Jehangir. There is a Circuit house on a hill near the lake that used to be British Residency. There is an island in the center of the lake which is accessible by boat. Boats could be hired from the east side of the Dault Bagh. There are Chowaptty and Jetty walkway next to each other and Baradari to capture the scenic of the lake. The lake is the biggest one in Ajmer, with the maximum catchments area (5 square km built up area). The maximum depth of lake is 4.4 m with storage capacity of 4.75 million cubic meter. The Rajasthan High Court has banned construction in the catchment areas of the lake basins.

title: Ana sagar Lake a historic palace
review: Founded by the grandfather of Prithivi Raj Chauhan, King Anaji Chauhan between 1135 -1150 AD, Ana Sagar Lake is an artificial lake. It is one of Ajmer’s most popular lakes and one of India’s largest lakes. Named after its founder, the lake was founded during the 12th century, after a dam was built across Luni River. Ana Sagar Lake is surrounded by Daulat Bagh Gardens and Khobra Behroon temple, two popular attractions of Ajmer.

title: Oasis in an Indian heritage town!!
review: Ana sagar lake in Ajmer is a beautiful lake surrounded by one of the oldest mountain Ranges (Aravallis) and amidst religion, culture and history of Rajasthan. It reflects how the ancient rulers of Rajasthan created tank system of irrigation and stored water so they could build cities for their citizens around it. There is a beautiful breeze in the walks created around it. There is a heritage embankment built by Mogul rulers in marble which affords a beautiful view of the lake and mountains.

title: Huge lake...beautiful in day.

title: Beautiful in the morning

But after the monsoon season it is a complete lake, where you can ride on boats to the little island sticking out of the water A lot of fish, by the way;if you lure it with bread, the water literally boils where rushes for feeding a whole shoal.

title: Ana Sagar morning view

title: Ana Sagar Lake
review: Ana Sagar Lake has been named after Anaji Chauhan. It is an artificial lake built by Anaji Chauhan, the grandfather of Prithvi Raj Chauhan. Dating from 1135 -1150 AD, the lake comprises catchments that were built with the help of local populace. Spread over 13 km, the lake also comprises Baradari or pavilions that were built by Shah Jahan in 1637.

title: Cool n wonderful
review: After years... I revisited Anasagar lake this October! And was so happy to see it as it was all those years ago...35 to be exact! The water was clean and moved with the breeze and standing at the baradaris, with the breeze blowing in my face, I soaked in the beautiful, calm presence of the lake, flowing for ages with the backdrop of Aravalis, standing guard over it! The place was mostly clean when I visited and lots of people thronged at the banks to feed the fish, which are aplenty.

title: A stroll
review: A quick stroll to check this lake.. Yes we did feed the fish.. But it's a v filthy lake which is a pity.. It offers a good walk, it's safe, a nice place to meet friends.. Good benches to sit n relax..

title: Looks good after rehabilitation !!
review: This lake in the middle of the city gives a calm and cool feeling to the dry city... once upon a time this was filthy but after efforts of teh administration this lake now looks clean and beautiful !!!

People are sleeping around,beggars all over place and the property is also not well maintained. lakes are dirty by bread crumbs which are being fed to fishes.

title: Huge, clean in the middle of the city
review: You just can;t avoid.

title: Better than expected!
review: Self with family was visiting Ajmer in Feb 2016. The primary aim was to visit Pushkar temple and Dargah Sharif. The hotel staff recommended us to visit Ana Sagar lake during free time. Being free on the first day evening, with nowhere else to visit (very few attractions in Ajmer), we decided to visit Ana Sagar lake ( with an apprehension that it may turn out to be a filthy pond). But surprisingly, it turned out to be one of the best places to visit in Ajmer. Beautifully maintained and surprisingly clean. Nice walk along the chowpaty, you can also hire a boat to go to the island in the middle of the lake. Feeding the fish (and the birds!) is another fun family activity. The sunset is beautiful and i am sure so will be the sunrise. With some more effort from the tourism deptt. this place can turn out to be one of the better attractions in Ajmer!

title: Very Good atteraction of City
review: The man made ana sagar lake is must see if you are visiting Ajmer, You can get best view of entire lake through Bajrang Garh temple or by walking on Baradari built by Shahjahan. Not very clean lake but good time pass  also you can do boating to artificial  island in middle of lake. Nearby attraction is Daulat Bagh.

title: Good place for taking a stroll and sitting on a bench admiring the lake

title: Walking next to the lake is just awesome
review: Its lovely to walk next to the Ana Sagar Lake. Nice breeze and i find it a lively place. Just that its not as clean as it should be thanks to locals who spill a lot.

title: Don't miss it
review: Most tourists tend to stay in the town of Pushkar, 13 kms away, and visit Ajmer on a day-trip (albeit wrongly in my opinion) so it’s likely that most never come to the lake. That's a pity because, despite the usual plastic bags and bottles found in most public places in India, it somehow makes for an interesting and tranquil diversion. Ana Sagar is an immense man-made lake constructed in the 12th century on the orders of one Anaji Chauhan, the king of the day. In the 17th century, Shah Jahan added pavilions and Jehangir, the eldest surviving son of Mughal Emperor Akbar, provided the adjoining Daulat Bagh gardens. The 21st-century inhabitants of Ajmer have provided the ugly detritus that litters and spoils the appearance of the historic gardens and lake!

The so called Chaupaati is better illuminated but has nothing really to be called Chaupaati except for the lone chaat waala tthela outside the gate! In fact if you are a food afficiando then areas in and around chudi bazaar qualify better as Chaupaati than this misnomer of a Chaupaati!

review: Situated on the way to Pushkar but one can reach there by walking.  It is near to Nashiyan Jain temple.At the entrance many street food sellers are there.On the side of the entry gate there is a path leading to a small mountain having a temple of lord Hanuman. There is no entry fee.You can feed fishes there and there food is available at the gate for Rs.10/- packet.The water is very dirty and oily.Though boating facilities are there(only boat ride, operated by  drivers) but looking at the water, better to be avoided.Only attraction is the series of beautiful marble pavilions standing besides the lake.Otherwise a nice place to spend your evening while you are in Ajmer.

title: Scenic place in Ajmer
review: Best place in Ajmer. Very beautiful. You should visit this place. Near by daulat bagh is another good attractions in Kolkata. Leisure place to spend some morning or evening time. You can also do boating in the lake. It also has one island restaurant as added attractions.

title: One of the must go in ajmer
review: Ana sagar lake is a must go place in ajmer..nicely located in the center of the city..has some of the best local eating places at the bajrangarh gate..so if you care for some spicy chaat do exit from that side..barahdari give a nice view of the lake so do check that out.

title: Peace and traniquility
review: Spent an entire evening by the lakeside. The vast lake and its beauty gives you a sense of joy and peace together. Some areas are dirty though.

title: Sudden visit
review: Boat riding, city view & one side surrounded Hill view that's all Ana Sagar Lake! Garden near lake is also nice space.

title: Amazing Lake
review: An Amazing lake which years back was mostly dry and had water only during rains.

title: Ideal tourist spot ... but poorly maintained
review: One of the biggest lakes I have seen - simply huge! The city of Ajmer is built around this immense water body.

title: One time visit
review: This is located around 5km from Ajmer railway station accessible by auto.This is an average attraction without any entry fees.The Lake is famous for the fishes which swims on the banks of the lake. There is a myth, if you offer flour balls to the fishes, your wish would be fulfilled. Flour balls are available near the lake.

title: nice visit for a quick glance
review: We went there by our own vehicle and was surprised to find that there was no dedicated parking lot for personal cars. The parking was already occupied by Tonga (horse cart) and auto rickshaws, but we somehow managed to park the car on road.

title: Big water body
review: Its a huge water body with no live streams of water

title: Nice calm place!
review: Its a big and beautiful lake surrounded by hills. The place is neat and clean but little crowdy. U can take some time to enjoy this place.

title: Nice to spend an evening with visit to lake and Bajrangghat
review: Ana Sagar is a nice place to spend the evening. Can get a bit crowded though. Enjoy a visit to Banrang ghat hanumanji temple near the lake. It is about 150 steps however the view from the top is splendid and the temple is simply beautiful. There is another stairway, which if open can be somewhat a shorter climb than the main one.. hence look out for the shortest stairway up the hills to the temple. After a visit to the temple, one can enjoy the pani puri and awesome pav bhaji in the food joints outside the temple premises. It is one of the best and often visited and recommended by the locals.

title: Lovely, quaint and peaceful.
review: Do visit this when you visit Ajmer. Especially from the Baradari, the old Mughal gardens and the newly built promenade.

title: Looks good at night
review: The place looks really good in the evening. Otherwise the locality is dusty, loud - the outer ring is not having footpath  ( and is the situation for Ajmer itself) - good place to spend some time. The lake is huge

title: Nice lake
review: I went there and stayed for about 2 hrs.

title: Water Body in the City
review: Nothing much to watch or look if you had visited the lake city, Udaipur.  If this is part of the itenary then you could possibly spend 15 minutes or ignore the place.  From the local person we were given to understand that the lake is not maintained well and most of the sewage gets into it.  We did not stop at this place even to take a snap. It is a huge water body however and we were in fact surprised that it is purely rain fed.

title: Beautiful Lake...Sorrounded by hill..must Visit
review: The lake is very beautiful. U will see fishes looking for food on the lake shore. The cool wind of the lake will freshen U up in the hot summer 2. Motor Boating is also available. Very nice place to cool off in the afternoon.The view is so panaromic. must visit place while in Ajmer.

title: Peaceful Ana Sagar Lake
review: It's one of the biggest lake I have seen after Chilka Lake. The scenery was utterly beautiful specially in the sunset, the silhouettes looked simply breath taking. This was my last spot of my 2 day solo trip. I reached here just before sunset and waited here till it was time to board my bus back to Delhi.

title: Peaceful Place
review: I went during the summer and I enjoyed it a lot. There was not a lot to do but there were somethings like ice cream vendors and horse carts. They weren't really pricy but affordable. You should visit this place with kids and friends.

title: Good place to enjoy the view
review: good place to do basic water sports activities like boating etc..This is a refreshing place on the way to pushkar..you will have a glance on it while going to Pushkar

title: Quite stinky these days!!
review: This artificial lake was built by Arno Raj Chauhan in the 12th century. The huge embankment was  erected with people's help.

title: Need proper Maintenance.
review: Nothing special. Can be converted in to beautiful place. But now a days there is no proper maintenance & cleanliness.

title: Peaceful and Calming
review: Beautiful & Peaceful.Not much to do but a nice stroll and has an important connection to Hzt Moinuddeen Chisty R.A

title: Great time and great stroll.
review: Absolutely worth visiting it! Go with a couple of hours at least for a leisurely stroll and discovery experience.

title: Great for 2-3 hour
review: Been there taken a short ride as well there loved place, Great to go in evening as you will get perfect view  combo of hill and lake with sunset, just amazing

title: Great view but needs more activities to attract tourists
review: Anasagar has its historic importance in Ajmer but since many years it hasn't got the attention from tourism department which it deserves. Luckily there has been some work recently and the lake now has a chowpati and a walkway is under construction. The chowpati which is easily approachable can be a decent experience if you have kids with you.

title: Average place
review: There is no such amusement. One chopati is there where you can enjoy the gol gappas and other streed food but all are not of good quality. Good place for joggers. Water is not so clean to swim. Overall it is simple place that can be visited once.

title: Lake in the City
review: Lake located near a beautiful garden like Place.

title: A beautiful place
review: a place of peace and attractive.You can spend your time with family or couple.

title: Not very happening
review: Its a good lake with good scenery. But not much happening. It feels like there should be more to it than street foods only. can go once.

title: Average Place
review: View is awesome. You can relax there. But lake is very dirty. There is man made island in this lake where you can go thru motor boat. That experience will be good but again lake is very dirty.

title: A nice lake but poorly maintained
review: The lake is very big and looks nice. However, tourists make the area dirty and sometimes shady. The administration by local authorities seem to be very poor.

title: Lake has loads of fishes
review: There are loads of fishes in the lake... we fed the fishes with rice flee and wheat flour..

title: The popular lake
review: This lake is best experienced after the rains . This lake has a very charming high embankments to walk by the side giving the full view interspersed with the seating for the tired visited . The garden around it is not great but the area is interesting . If you are in Ajmer and have time after Sacred Dargah and Adhai  Din Ka Jhopdaa - you can keep it in the iterinary .

title: Pathetic and dirty lake
review: Well, this lake is as much dirty as my childhood village pound. Pathetic boating and island i must say. I will never recommend anybody to visit this place,albeit there is no entry fees in the Daulath bagh. The boating cost Re. 70/pp and they will took you an artificial island. That so called island itself is very dirty and staff there is illiterate and ill-mannered. Must not visit for anybody. if anybody wanna see the proof of my above said review , they can ask me for pics of there as i dnt knw how to upload pics here.

title: Forget everything and take a dip
review: Yes leave the reviews, just keep your shorts ready and take a dip. You shall enjoy. If nothing else, just the people and energy around the ghats will be enough for to get energised for the quick dip.

title: A Nice Lake
review: While coming back from Pushkar we visited this tourist place. Ana sagar Lake is an artificial lake spread in 13 km and was built by Anaji Chauhan before approx. 900 years. A well  maintained lake with spectacular view. We hired a boat and enjoyed all surroundings. a Nice visit.

title: royal feeling
review: the moment i stepped there i loved the place water moglai patternpillars lovely breeze its n  excellent place to sit n relax.take some wheatflour balls being sold there n feed the fish having a cuppachai from chaiwala lovely place.

title: Cool Breezy Air place in Hot Weather.
review: Cool Breezy Air place in Hot Weather. This Lake is well known for this sweet water and the water from this Lake is given to Whole Ajmer and Some Part of Pushkar. I would say as the Name says Anna Sagar Lake is one of the Not to miss place when we travel to Ajmer.

title: Ana Sagar Lake : The best lake
review: Water is clean. The Aravali range around the lake is a natural decoration to this water body. The lake gives unmatched experience in terms of satisfaction.

title: "Nice lake"
review: It is nice artificial lake in ajmer, It  was built by Anaji Chauhan,so many tourists come here every year to see the beauty of this lake.

title: Ana Sagar lake: Fusion of Natural and Architectural beauty
review: The Ana Sagar lake one on hand depicts the scenic beauty surrounded by the Aravali mountain range while on the other it has the architectural masterpiece of Baradari at its foot.

title: Nice place but less caring by nagar nigam
review: Its just awesome place ... nice view.. bt the worst part is local authority dont spend much on garden cleaning moreover tourist must use dustbin... now days oxygen pump there in lake bt in garden still need improvement from tourist side as well  govt. Authorities.... I advise govt. Should not allow food packets in park... overall nice place ... a archaeological site too...  4 out of 5.

title: Need some renovation
review: This place is very near to the Bus stand of Ajmer also near to the the reknowned hospital in Ajmer. But this place need some renovation of some exciting stuffs to be added to this place to attract more travellers.

title: Bajrang Garh Darshan
review: A man made lake is a attraction in Ajmer having Chowpati and jogging track. While traveling by the side of lake towards city you will see a War Tank displayed by the side of road which belongs to Pakistan and captured by our Army. There is Hanuman Temple on hill by the side of this tank called " bajrang garh ". It is one is the cleanest and well maintained temple I have ever seen.. When you reach top you can see Ana Sagar lake on the back..A beautiful location for sunset too..

title: Ana Sagar Lake
review: We saw the View Point from the Circuit House in Ajmer. We Saw the Sunset and Then we left for Jaipur. and also was beautiful lake point. The City is Surrounded by the Lake which is on the west of the circuit house in Ajmer. Beautiful Sunset Point in Ajmer. Closer to Circuit house is The Ajmer Dargah Sheriff in The City. And Worth Visiting Ajmer. It was my First Trip. and my ancestrial home in Ajmer on the Srinagar Road. I never went to Ajmer in my life time but Visiting Ajmer was a memorable trip. We visited Ajmer and Pushkar with my father's friends in January 2015.

title: Nice lake but uncared for
review: It is to the west of the circuit house in Ajmer.  A large lake where one can see a variety of different birds.  There are many small food stalls along the road that skirts the lake.  While they make a convenient stop for a drink of sugarcane juice or a quick bite the huge number of plastic bags and garbage is ruining the lakefront.

title: Ana Sagar Lake, Ajmer
review: A man-made lake which was built in 1135 -1150 AD. The lake is widely spread in a large area. We witnessed a beautiful view of this lake on our way to Pushkar as the city of Pushkar is at an average elevation of 510 m from Ajmer. Had a soothing time sitting near to this lake in the evening.

title: Nice Place
review: It is a nice lake.Go there in evening.Only thing is this lake is very dirty.It is around 2.5 km from station.

title: Nice Lake
review: Ana Sagar lake in Ajmer, is a nice lake. One can visit during the eveining and relax here for some time. It is was built by Anaji Chauhan, the grandfather of Prithvi Raj Chauhan. The pavilions were built by Shahjahan in 1637 and Daulat Bagh Gardens by Jehangir. There is a small Island in the center of the lake. One can visit the island by boat. Boat ride is costly though. You can take small pieces of bread and throw it in the lake to see the small fishes pounding at it.

title: lack proper maintenance
review: ana sagar is beautiful and clean area,but most of the love birds litter on the walls of the area.Lake view full of birds, roaming around.It is good to see them and feeding fish is another joy.

title: Historical Lake
review: The lake has histirical event. I like the view and boating but I dislike the timing for the boating games and pleasure.Besides another ferry service is availabe to visit a small island nearby.

title: “Nice Lake”
review: Ana Sagar lake in Ajmer, is a nice lake.Lake view full of birds, roaming around.It is good to see them and feeding fish is another joy.Boat ride is costly though. You can take small pieces of bread and throw it in the lake to see the small fishes pounding at it.

title: Good place to walk in evening
review: The pavilions were built by Shahjahan in 1637 and Daulat Bagh Gardens by Jehangir. There is a small Island in the center of the lake.The lake is widely spread in a large area(13sqkm). It is around 2.5 km from station. There are many small food stalls along the road that skirts the lake. While they make a convenient stop for a drink of sugarcane juice or a quick bite the huge number of plastic bags and garbage is ruining the lakefront. There is Hanuman Temple on hill by the side of this tank called " bajrang garh ". It is one is the cleanest and well maintained temple I have ever seen.. When you reach top you can see Ana Sagar lake on the back..A beautiful location for sunset too..

title: Nice to roam in evening
review: Though this place has a history, it is also a nice tourist attraction.

title: Amazing sunset at Anna Sagar Lake
review: I found the atmosphere more relaxing and pious than the Dargah,thanks to three boys singing kawalis and paying their tribute to khwaja amazingly well.Otherwise too the view is beautufl from here,being surrounded by hills and having an island in the middle,which can be reached via boating.

title: Good place to enjoy quite time
review: Since it was an official trip and I have some free time around 7 in the evening. Spent 1 hour was here, place was good, neat and clean. Ambiance was quite and good, fountains and light arrangement middle of the lake was looking awesome.

title: Just pacifying
review: I pass by daily this place. Going there and relaxing at silent hours is really helpful to relieve stress.

title: Anasagar- not only a lake but Identity of Ajmer-
review: When you are at Ajmer you must visit Anasagar Lake ;it is the identity of Ajmer;once Mughal Jahangeer was an often visitor-nice place to visit with a historical cap-----

title: Vast Expanse of Water - Amazing
review: This is like the lungs of Ajmer, breathing space for the busy city. Its  kind of a bird sanctuary with many migratory birds seen here. Morning mist and dew is an interesting view..

title: Ana Sagar Lake
review: It is an artificial lake Anaji Chauhan, the grandfather of Prithvi Raj Chauhan, in 1135 -1150 AD. Later the baradari was built by Shahjahan in 1637 on the embankment. There are five pavilions and a royal bath. The pavilions are similar in construction to the Diwan-i-am of Red Fort in Delhi. The garden is built by Jahangir and is well maintained.

title: Best Lake of Ajmer
review: This Lake is situated at the heart of the city. Very big lake which houses beautiful birds and we enjoyed the sunset in the evening.

title: Beautiful artificial lake
review: Ana sagar is spread over approx 13 kms area. It was built by Anaji Chauhan, the grandfather of Prithvi Raj Chauhan, in 1135 -1150 AD and is named after him.

title: Fantastic lake
review: Fantastic place to visit at lazy afternoons....We visited there & felt blown away with the beauty of this place.

title: Great-fun-enjoy
review: Really me and my family enjoy a lot,beautiful garden with a lake and ejoyed boating there with my family,my cute little daughter ejoy a lot,she was throwing bread pieces in water to feed the fish.

title: Beautiful Lake, dirty surroundings
review: Beautiful lake, awesome views. Surrounding are very dirty (we went via some garden). The water at shore looked quite dirty perhaps people throwing food for fish and trash.

title: Visit if you have time to spare
review: You admittedly don't go to Ajmer to visit the Anasagar Lake, but while you are there it is a good idea to take some time out to visit this man-made water body. The place may not be as beautiful as the Dal Lake, Srinagar or even the Pichola Lake, Udaipur, yet  it does lend some refreshing looks to the city of Dargah Sharief. It is bounded by hills on three sides, while the city is located on the fourth side. It is certainly not a must visit, but boating in the lake may be taken for its tranquil experience. Chaupati, the half kilometer long platform on one side of the lake, is a favorite of the morning walkers. In case you are staying near it, you can also start your day on a healthy note.

title: The only water body within Ajmer
review: Ana Sagar lake is a man made lake in the middle of Ajmer. This lake was made during the Mughal era to supply water to the city.

title: Nice for early morning joging
review: Its close to my room so every morning I was there for jogging , they have a good garden with enough sitting space, morning walker and health canscious daily u find in morning, its very nice that during my time lake was full so its been very nice to watch during jogging, even u can find fresh juices in morning who offer you small glass in very cheap price. its only minus point that no toilet facility near by.

title: The Best place
review: I have no words to say about this place. Though the water of the lake is dirty but there a lot of fun activities here to do. 2-3 hours could be easily spend here. Children relish visiting here, particularly the swings and the visit to the Island in the middle of the lake.

title: Nothing great
review: Just to kill some time at the lake side. Nothing great about it but good to spend some time to relax and have a break.

title: A great water body!
review: This is a larger lake situated just about 3Kms from the Dargah Sharief! This lake has got much relevance according to Islam! People takes their bath from this lake! Even though the lake seems to be very dirty there alot of people taking thier morning bath here! The park situated here makes the kids engaged!

title: Ana Sagar
review: Very Big and clean, but people visiting this place are making it dirty and throwing all the left out items in this area making it unclean.

title: Poorly maintained
review: Had it been maintained well by the authorities, it would have been a nice place to sit and relax. Its a huge lake with boating options and an island restaurant. You feel good sitting idle on its bank but its hard to find a neat place there.

title: Can be tried
review: It's not a place so much famous that someone visit this specially but if someone have time and can manage than try to visit this place for simple reason which is good view overall of hills along water which is respectably much clear and clear and it does not have any stinking smell or so. Try if u can visit and spend some time but make sure to check how is the climate which matter as it can be too cold in winter usual and can be too hot in summer if it's after noon so choose accordingly.

title: Excellent picnic spot.
review: The lake has a captivating view, and good crowd is present on weekends.  Nice place to relax and stroll around the Baradari.  The place has also boating facility and a restaurant in the middle of the lake.

title: An impressive man made lake
review: An impressive manmade lake covering an area of about 10-13km in total. Very basic parkinf facilities, very poor pathway and footpath connectivity. There is boating available and there is an island in the middle of the lake which can be access by means of there boats.

title: water in bowl.
review: This sagar is surrounded by mountains and looks like water in a bowl. This was made by Grandfather of Prithvi Raj Chauhan and lots of story behind this Sagar. Khwaja Ghareeb Nawaz(R.A) stayed here when he visited to Ajmer first time.

title: a lake away from city of lakes
review: on way back from pushkar to Ajmer, you may visit this place.

title: Adds a serene touch to Ajmer
review: We only saw it from the car, but it looked big and relatively clean. Adds to the sereneness of Ajmer.

title: Clean!
review: Looked clean, restaurant in the middle of the lake though you don't get much stuff there but still worth a visit for the boating experience....great sun set view

title: a lake away from city of lakes
review: Looked clean, restaurant in the middle of the lake though you don't get much stuff there but still worth a visit for the boating experience....great sun set view

title: Awesome feeling
review: I went to Ana Sagar with my mom and I was feeling nostalgic as I had visited this place as a child and i am coming back after 20 years and i was left speechless.

title: Nothing worth mentioning
review: Except for the serenity of the man made large lake, the adjoining garden is poorly kept. Free for all entry has made it a very crowded place and also dirty.

title: perfect
review: very very awsome place, i have been there with family, every member is satisfied about he beauty of the lake, frankly we enjoy well!!!!

title: Must visit after 4pm... Wow!
review: This lake is at around 2km from ajmer railway station. Perfect place to hangout around evening.

title: Disappointing
review: It could really do with a little development, whilst the lake itself is pretty, it would be nice to have a few basic facilities which would actually attract more people to turn it into a great place to visit. It’s okay for a stroll.

title: Nice place
review: To spend time with family in the evening. I think there should be more benches to sit as its always crowded in the evening.

title: Beautiful lake
review: Beautiful lake in heart of Ajmer city. It gets very Crowded in evenings. Needs proper maintenance. Otherwise nice place to spend in evening.

title: An oasis in the desert town
review: It was a pleasant surprise to see the lake all filled up in the summer season and we enjoyed the evening there

title: From Bajarang Garh
review: From Bajarang garh temple of Hanumanji  when you looks Ana sagar and khwamkhwah ka darwaza at sunset time you feel on top of the world

title: Excellent
review: You can have a calm evening, admiring royal life of maharajas who used to stay in mahals, and how this place would really look at those times, complete marble masterpiece with lots of detailed craftsmanship.

title: Like all other lakes
review: It's a lake, like all other lakes. It might be soothing on some day for you. These days, the water level and quality has reduced drastically. Poor maintenance.

title: Full of parking problems
review: Its a fledging waterbody right in the heart of city but lot of issues with no footpath and parking problems.

title: Peaceful lake
review: The lake is a archeological place...u can do boating their...their are  lot of fishes in the lake...u can take fish food from the roadside vendors and feed the fishes...their is also a fun world for small children...a toy train and small rides...also u can do pedal boating..rs. 40 for a couple....u can walk to anna sagar from the dargah sharif...around 2 kms....best place is to go around 5 p.m. around sun set...

title: Why it is called Ana Sagar?
review: This lake was dug up by some british ruler. One Ana (6 paisa ) was paid to each labour per day. That is why it,s name became famous as Ana Sagar.

title: Very disappointing
review: There are no facilities, it could have been developed as a great spot, but in the evening there are only dim lights on the shore.

title: Needs large dustbins as well as patrolling
review: The lake and the baradari are beautiful - very nice location for an evening stroll - the problem is that it is very dirty and not too safe - too many pickpockets and rowdy elements around. AVOID the boat ride.

title: Beautiful lake but requires cleaning.
review: It was a beautiful lake with nice walk way on its bank side.But it was very dirty & has to be cleaned by local authority.

title: Good to See
review: The lake is situated at pushkar which is 22 kms from Ajmer. Nice to see such a big lake in middle of desert. But please be aware of local touts and pundits. Water is not fit for bathing.

title: Dirty - Needs a good clean up of all the rubbish
review: The views could be nice - and the garden could be pleasurable ... BUT : It is very dirty

title: very nice place
review: Very Nice place and childeren very enjoy , enjoy in bording with family, good Exprence and very enjoy

title: Big and nice from a Distance
review: The lake is quite big and nice looking from a distance but a closer look would tell that it is quite dirty with loads of Garbage floating all around. Their is a small island in the middle of the lake with plenty of boats to take you there. The administration has built a small corridor at one side for people to stay at the shore to enjoy in the evenings.

title: What Shahjahan saw
review: Over-run by weeds/pollution and by commoners like us but still gives one a vision of the manner in which royalty once lived in this land. Majestic vistas but shabby environs and poor maintenance. Well worth a visit though.

title: Calm scene
review: I visited ana sagar lake it was a quite peaceful experience, not so commercialize it gives feel of a 90's tourist place. i found it peaceful place for spend some time and think about your stuff.

title: ill maintained dirty place.
review: Very dirty place.We were disappointed having come all the way to see this ill maintained otherwise would have been a nice tourist spot in the middle of the city.Rajasthan tpurism department should do something to keep up the standard of this place.Unless they improve I strongly recommend not to visit.

title: serenity in ajmer
review: i would call this the best place to hangout in ajmer.its quite a big lake with a tiny island in between. its a man made lake but who cares...its provides the much needed cooling effect to hot and dry ajmer. it gets pretty crowded in the evening with people of all age groups chilling out. the breeze is refreshing. loads of vendors selling eatables. one can get a calm break from the hustle bustle of the city.

title: A good outing place.
review: It is a very good lake surrounded by hills. Residents come here to spend an evening and it is a good outing place.

title: Nice for a walk
review: It is a nice place, not so touristic, plenty of women with their children having picnic. You can feel quite unconfortable when everybody starts taking pictures of you (even if you look like indian, but you wear occidental coothes)

title: What a view..........
review: Ana Sagar Lake is an artificial lake situated in the city of Ajmer in Rajasthan state in India. It is was built by Anaji Chauhan, the grandfather of Prithvi Raj Chauhan, in 1135 -1150 AD and is named after him. The catchments were built with the help of local populace. The Baradari or pavilions were built by Shahjahan in 1637 and Daulat Bagh Gardens by Jehangir. The lake is spread over 13 Kilometers. There is a Circuit house on a hill near the lake that used to be British Residency. There is an island in the center of the lake which is accessible by boat or water scooter. Boats and water scooters could be hired from the east side of the Dault Bagh. The lake gets dry every summar. The Rajasthan High Court has banned construction in the catchment areas of the lake basins. This is one of the beautiful lake in India. It's situated near the CHILLA of Khwaja Moinuddin CHishti (R.A) due to which this place is famous and it's also one of the the world heritage sites. If anyone wants to get free from sadness please go to this place as it's view will make you sadfreeeeeee.

title: Never Ever Visit
review: in Pictures, this place looks awesome, but our genuine request to everyone is that even juhu beach is a cleaner and much better place than Ana Sagar Lake.

title: great views but badly maintained
review: The ana sagar lake is a nice big lake but the surroundings are very badly maintained. It is just worth a drive around but you can surely miss getting out of your car and visiting one of the ghats

title: Marble pavilions by man made lake
review: We went for an evening walk here and it was very busy, with lots of locals doing the same thing. The marble pavilions were built by Shah Jahan, supposedly out of marble left over from the Taj Mahal. There was quite a lot of litter unfortunately. Another off putting thing was that we were constantly stopped by people wanting their photo taken with our daughter.

title: Ana sagar- good place for an evening stroll
review: Well the comments reflect the personal preferences of fellow travelers visiting Ana sagar lake. Many  visitors will agree that despite the amazing diversity in India, from the cleanliness point of view, many if not all locations in India are dusty and  full of heaps of garbage. So one needs to find a place that gives a bit of  solace under these conditions. From this perspective, in Ajmer, visiting the Ana sagar lake especially the  park where the marble pavilions  get some unpleasant feelings  of rubbish and dust off your mind. I visited the place in  a hot summer and it was definitely a get away for me. It is pretty crowded and to some extent not well maintained. But the marble pavilions erected by mughuls are fantastic. I think a visitor to Ajmer especially  foreigners need to have a look at it. Full credits to the Indian government for re establishing its former glory after British colonialists built several concrete structures in here. Indian government demolished all these buildings and the Mughul Bagh (garden) was re created  for the recreational activities  of the general public. It is a nice place to go and get your mind relaxed having strolled in the bagh by the side of the Ana sagar lake.

title: BEAUTIFUL PLACE TO ENJOY YOUR EVENING
review: It is a good place to be visited and for spending few hours at this historical lake, which is on the bank of BARADARI build by Mughal emperor some 350 years ago.

title: very beautiful place
review: This place is very beautiful,it feels very great to enjoy the scenes(specially in evening) of lake Anasagar. The sitting area made up of white marble add beauty to it. it was january when i visited this place and I would love to visit this place again.

title: Returning To Glory
review: This 800 year Old man made lake was built by Anaji Chauhan the Grand Father of great warrior Prithvi Raj Chauhan. 100s of years later King Jehangir.patrinised the lake by bulding a Marble Pavallion on one of the banks with a Steb Garden Daulat Bagh later rechristened as Subhash Udyaan.

title: Poor maintenance
review: Disappointed to see such a beautiful lake being wasted. Sunset was good there & nice breeze in the evening

title: nice lake
review: This 800 year Old man made lake was built by Anaji Chauhan the Grand Father of great warrior Prithvi Raj Chauhan. 100s of years later King Jehangir.patrinised the lake by bulding a Marble Pavallion on one of the banks with a Steb Garden Daulat Bagh later rechristened as Subhash Udyaan. This place is very beautiful,it feels very great to enjoy, Sunset is good there & nice breeze in the evening

title: lake is beautiful
review: lake is beautiful , lot of marble type flooring for the tourists and pass by, a beautifull garden is attached to the lake make it more beautifull.

title: average
review: The place is good, can do with a bit of cleaning though. You have to have private transport to reach there. Nice place to sit and relax

title: Lake view and Seasons
review: The lake view and the feel good factor as suggested by other reviewers is weather dependent.

title: A beautiful Man Made Lake with History
review: Though not maintained and kept unwell , the place around has some charm and history to attract you. The marble pillars , water flowing and the sun setting -- what a view i got when i visited this place first time. I still remember this place as a morning jogging track with my father and friends. I adore this place since my childhood. A recommended place to visit if you have time and an eye for the mother nature.

title: Not very developed for tourist...
review: Anasagar lake has a great potential to develop as a great tourist destination, but currently no boating facility is available here..

title: what a scenic beauty
review: even in the rainy season this place is a must visit. a LAKE with a beautiful place in the middle.. boating facility is there.. the sitting place made at the time of moughal are the best part of this place. i loved to visit and sit there for a long time..

title: Beautiful place to visit
review: Very clean place, nice and well maintained walkway. Morning visit shall ensure you clean air. In evening it is a happening place. If you are going on Sunday or holiday, you can spot Happy Street situations wherein Yoga going on, people riding bicycles etc. Overall if you are in Ajmer town it is a must visit place on your list.

title: What a SunRise experience @ Ana Sagar
review: We reached here around @8 AM and it was like nature at its best.

title: Anasagar Lake View
review: Anasagar Lake View in itself is mesmerizing with the Seiberian Birds comming in winter season makes it worthwhile

title: Beautiful lake
review: This was large lake situated in Ajmer city. Its spread in 13 kilometer area. We have too its visit in evening time. Beautiful lake, Must visit place.

title: Nice  Peaceful place
review: Nice  Peaceful place, you can have a evening walk around the lake .not very far from the dargah. should visit if in ajmer

title: Beautiful lake with scenic beauty
review: We visited with while family and found this place a total family and children place for fun. Me and wife has total satisfaction as we were there during the sunset and found the place very beautiful. It’s a huge lake surrounded with great scenery..one must visit

title: Good for a early morning walk
review: Ideal for a good early morning walk. You can see lot of migratory birds in this lake. Surprisingly, in the garden, there is place even to feed rats, ideal for a good photography.

title: Nice look
review: Ana Sagar lake gives good look of Ajmer  Nicely developed place for enjoyment  with full of pleasure with kids

title: Evening walk at Ana Sagar Lake
review: Quite clean and no smell at all , the Ana Sagar lake is a feather in cap of Ajmer City.

title: Birdwatchers paradise
review: Anasagar lake is one of the oldest manmade lake in Asia. Created by the kind n noble king of chahamana dynasty, it fulfills drinking needs of Ajmer city.
